Description: St. Jude Medical Inc., a heart device manufacturer; Parma Community General Hospital; and Norton Healthcare have paid the United States $3,898,300 to resolve false claim allegations that St. Jude paid illegal kickbacks to two hospitals to secure heart-device business. The kickbacks included alleged rebates that were "retroactive" and paid based on a hospital's previous purchases of St. Jude heart-device equipment and rebates that St. Jude paid for purchases of heart-device equipment sold by its competitors to induce purchases of similar equipment from St. Jude in the future.

The physician and hospital partners of the Passport Health Plan agreed to pay restitution to Passport in settlement of allegations of improper and illegal cash transfers made to them from Passport. Passport is the vendor that operates the healthcare services for Medicaid in the Greater Louisville area. The investor-members also made up the board and it is alleged they paid themselves the money because Passport would not have been granted a rate increase by the state with the $30.5 million on its books.

Private Litigation Case Title: Disselkamp et al v. Norton Healthcare, Inc. et al

Info Source: Extracted from a download of OSHA's Enforcment Data downloaded on 3/02/2022, available at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_catalogs.php
